rComments: Excellent Professor. Very knowledgable and helpful. He is passionated about his subjects and are eager to transmit this passion. Can sometimes explain things in abstract terms but are very willing to reexplain and simpify too. Takes his courses, one of my favorites at ucsc,

The course I took by this professor was one of the most useful courses during my time at UCSC. He is very passionate about his lectures and very concise. Does a great job of engaging students and incorporating current events into his lectures. He is extremely intelligent and a great edition to the Legal Studies dept. He is also very attractive!

He talked like a textbook and I could not follow his train of thought for more than a minute. Seems annoyingly pretentious about everything. Does not seem approachable at all. Assigned way too much reading. Class was not what I was expecting and turned out to be the worst one I've ever taken at UCSC.

Mr. Lozano is a fascinating addition to the HisCon and Politics departments. His Political Jurisprudence class was amazing. His HisCon 139A (Market Crisis/ Future of Capitalism) is the best class I have ever taken at this school. He introduces the world of financial markets in a way that will make even Environment Science majors weak at the knees.

Lozano is an intelligent man who has a passion for what he teaches. Class is not mandatory, but he WILL KNOW if you attend class regularly. There is a lot of reading but its manageable and necessary for the quizzes. The essays aren't bad either. Do them early so he can look over them. Overall I would recommend him! He's also pretty hot!!!
Excellent professor. I'd say one of the best in UCSC. His readings are numerous and demanding but you will definitely learn a great deal.

Ben is a great teacher who will work with students in and out of class to achieve concept mastery. Unfortunately, many students don't realize that they need to READ in college to pass the class! If you do the work, then you will pass the class- he's not out to trick you.

His powerpoints are mainly for highlighting quotes so if you haven't done the reading, you'll leave more confused than you started.  He knows his stuff and is just exploding with info, must keep up with the reading/ask questions to appreciate the logic and flow of this course.

Professor Lozano is a nice guy who really knows what he's talking about. He tends to not answer questions clearly and sometimes just needs to get to the point faster. He is really intelligent and the class is interesting and educational, but it was very difficult to keep up with the reading and to keep up with him.

took political jurisprudence in the fall and was a very insightful class. after taking his poli. juris. class he invited his students to test themselves by taking his senior capstone. by far a great college experience and a great decision ive made. i learned alot with dr. lozano and he knows his stuff. you will learn something new guaranteed.

Great professor. Knows the law. It's a shame most of his lecture goes right over the heads of the class even if they did the reading. You have to engage the reading and ask questions in class. Probably one of the most satisfying and exciting learning experiences of my academic life. If you're a lightweight or looking for an easy class don't take this class.

HE'S SEXY. that's all i went to his class for. i dropped out of his marxist class eventually because the  reading was dense and his lectures and the videos he showed were boring. he's intelligent though, so take him if you are serious about the class...or badly need eye candy

He has word-by-word-pre-written lectures. Extensive reading,≈7 books + articles and case law. I did ok without doing any reading. Take this class if you are really interested in what is addressed in the course. If you have some difficulties with keeping up with the reading, I suggest you take an other class because his lectures does not clari

Dr. Lozano is an extremely knowledgeable and talented professor who strives to help students when they have questions.  I went to his office hours numerous times and was very satisfied with the help I received.  He is extremely intelligent and is passionate about the subjects that he teaches.  I could not have asked for a better experience.

Lectures are dense, but if you do the reading they are extremely clear and make a lot of sense. Lozano is truly an expert at what he teaches,so if you try to insult his intelligence, you will know that you did. But  he's a chill dude. He would always chop it up with the students like a homie. Take his class you will learn a lot. Lozano is the sh*t!

His lectures are dense, it was hard for me to follow along most of the time. But he does teach upper divisions so it is to be expected that his lectures are at this level. A he's still a young professor, once he has more years under his belt, I'm sure he would stray away from his notes during lecture. Awesome guy, talk to him if you need help.

Ben Lozano is a great professor. His lectures are hard to follow but it doesn't mean you won't get anything out of it at the end of the day. Truly knowledgeable at what he teaches, it's more helpful if you talk to him if you're concerned about your grade and/or status in the class. It seems that he has high expectations, but he's very fair.

Lectures are not only a total snooze fest but even when I *can* stay awake they're mostly about nothing. He reads his entire lecture so it's uninformative rhetoric. Approached him once for help, he was slightly condescending. Seems really nice to the students he already knows and completely faithless in everyone else. Relatively uninspiring class.

Great guy, friendly, intelligent, helpful. Got me interested in the Middle East and Central Asia.    UCSC NEEDS MORE BEN LOZANOS instead of professors that just spit left wing propaganda (im left wing, but some professors don't back up there Ideas with facts, I.E. "because I said so") Comparing liberal theory to "Barry Bonds' Huge head." classic...

Hey, here's Lozano! I actually had him at SJSU in the fall of '07 (at 7:30 AM...) and despite the number of meetings I missed I enjoyed the class. He gives good lectures and is very knowledgeable. I had some great conversations with him the couple of times I went to his office hours. Very approachable and friendly. I highly recommend him.

This is the first politics course I took at UCSC. It got me into doing the politics major. Largely because he's foxy, and because I did well on the papers. But he showed too many movies in the class that I took (seriously, "Brazil!"? What was that?)

I think that he is very knowledgeable in the topic but is a horrible lecturer. I am a pretty studious student and found his class impossible to follow. His planned lectures are horrible because he speak to fast. He is unreasonable in his expectations and I think it is a complete useless waste of time to take his class. Very disappointed. Unreasonab

A complete and total genius. One of the best lecturers I've had, though most lectures go way over the heads of the majority of the class. Must keep up with reading. Planned lectures don't bother me, as what he reads are quotes.
Great teacher and a great class. The best one I had so far in santa cruz.

Prof. Lozano is a decent lecturer. He definitely has extensive knowledge of the material, but he reads entirely from a pre-written lecture, I think, which is kind of a bummer. Also, for being so informed about the subject, it makes me cringe every time I hear him say "I-rack" and "I-ran". Kills me. Otherwise though, a very good class.
No Comments

Great class. New and interesting approach. Obscure and un-pc reading. First introduction to Carl Schmitt. Class incorporates European philosophy and applies to contemporary events. Great film screenings with each lecture.
